div.p: The EI data type is used in the following data types and segments for a wide variety of "things" such as orders, products, devices, documents, even segments etc. I imagine most resources that represent these "things" will have an Identifier element that corresponds. We will have to think about how we document flavors of identifiers which are unique fields today (placer/filler, parent IDs, etc) for which the FHIR resources don't have specific concepts.

tr.td: Specifies an identifier assigned to an entity by the placer system
Specifies an identifier assigned to an entity by the filler system.
Specifies the facility in which the institutional privilege is/was valid.

The unique identifier that represents the physical location as a whole without regard for the individual components. This accommodates sites that may have a different method of defining physical units or who may code at a less granular level.

td.p: A unique identifier for the address. This component allows an address to be uniquely identified, and enables the linking of a single address to multiple people and contexts.

A unique identifier for the phone number or e-mail address. This component allows a phone number to be uniquely identified, and enables the linking of a single phone number to multiple people and contexts.

tr.td: This field contains a value that uniquely identifies a single allergy for a person. It is unique across all segments and messages for a person. If a system maintains allergen codes as a unique identifier for a particular allergy, then this field should not be used.
This field is the placer application's order number
This field is the order number associated with the filling application

The Order Workflow Profile references/represents the information necessary to define the workflow variant when that is not fully described through the use of ORC-1 Order Control and MSH-21 Message Profile.
This field is the placer application's order number
This field is the order number associated with the filling application

The Observation Group ID is the identifier assigned by the producer of a result to uniquely identify the results associated with this OBR segment. The Observation Group ID is intended to remain the same regardless of the change in status to the result (i.e., it is not a snapshot ID).
The Parent Observation Group ID field relates this child OBR to its parent OBR segment using the Observation Group ID of the parent result.

The placer numbers of the service request(s) to which this TQ2 segment links the current service request. This field should be populated with the appropriate "Placer number" from the current service request. For orders, the Placer Order Number from ORC-2 is the appropriate "Placer number".

The filler numbers of the service request(s) to which this TQ2 segment links the current service request. This field should be populated with the appropriate "Filler number" from the current service request. For orders, the Filler Order Number from ORC-3 is the appropriate "Filler number".

The placer group numbers of the service request(s) to which this TQ2 segment links the current service request. This field should be populated with the appropriate "Placer group number" from the current service request. For orders, the Placer Group Number from ORC-4 is the appropriate "Placer group number".

A workflow-management IDIS generated number that identifies the Filler Order for an Imaging Service (Imaging Service Request). This identifier corresponds one-to-one to the Order Filler number but is used in internal tracking of the work by the IDIS and in communication between IDIS within the department
This field is the identifier of the Requested Procedure that the workflow management IDIS selected to perform as a part of the order for the imaging service.

Globally unique identifier assigned by the workflow management IDIS to the Imaging Study under which all images and other DICOM objects produced in the course of the Requested Procedure shall be collected.

This field is the identifier of a particular Procedure Step (sub-procedure) of the Requested Procedure that the workflow management IDIS selected to perform as a part of the order for imaging service.
This field identifies the instance of the modality resource being requested for the performance of a particular Scheduled Procedure Step
The Donation ID is the unique identification number assigned to a blood donation
This field identifies the lot number for blood derivatives or commercially supplied items used as accessories to transfusion
This field is a unique system-generated number assigned to the blood product to which the message is referring.
The donation ID is the unique identification number assigned to a blood donation.
This field identifies the lot number for blood derivatives or commercially supplied items used as accessories to transfusion
This field is a unique system-generated number assigned to the blood product to which the message is referring
This field contains a unique identifier, Donation Identification Number (DIN), for the specific donation
The sample identifier for the sample collected during a donation for the purpose of testing. This is a field for sample or specimen identifiers.
The blood unit identifier is a unique identifier assigned to the particular blood unit in a container

This field contains a value that uniquely identifies the medication associated with this segment. At this time, there are no documented use cases for this field in the context of a pharmacy/treatment orders as described in this chapter. This statement does not preclude the use of RXO-29 in pharmacy messages, but implementers should exercise caution in using this field outside of the Patient Care context until the pharmacy/treatment use cases are established.

This field contains a value that uniquely identifies this segment across time and messages. At this time, there are no documented use cases for this field in the context of a pharmacy/treatment orders as described in this chapter. This statement does not preclude the use of RXO-30 in pharmacy messages, but implementers should exercise caution in using this field outside of the Patient Care context until the pharmacy/treatment use cases are established
This field contains an identifier for the individual product instance for the dispense occurrence.

This field contains an identifier for the individual product instance for the dispense occurrence. This differs from RXG-25 Give Barcode Identifier in that RXG-25 may include other workflow content or the product at various levels of granularity. RXG-31 specifically identifies the product instance
This field contains an identifier for the individual product instance for the dispense occurrence.
This field is used when the billing system is requesting observational reporting justification for a charge. This is the number used by a filler to uniquely identify a result.
This field contains a value that uniquely identifies a single diagnosis for an encounter. It is unique across all segments and messages for an encounter
This field contains the entity identifier for the parent diagnosis. This field links the "current" manifestation diagnosis ("*") to the entity identifier of the "parent" etiological diagnosis ("+").
This field contains a value that uniquely identifies a single procedure for an encounter. It is unique across all segments and messages for an encounter
This field contains a procedure ID which points to the procedure group (e.g., complete surgery) in which this instance belongs
This field contains the identifier of the accident report assigned by a jurisdiction that is required in the insurance accident claim.

Retained for backwards compatibility as of v 2.7 only. This field is now represented through the PRT segment. This field identifies the Equipment Instance (e.g., Analyzer, Analyzer module, group of Analyzers, etc.) responsible for the production of the observation

This field contains a unique identifier for this observation. This instance identifier is persistent between messages. At this time, there are no documented use cases for this field in the context of messages as described in this chapter.
The shipment identifier is the identifier assigned by the shipment transportation provider that uniquely identifies this shipment from all other shipments by the same provider.
This field contains a unique identifier of the specific participation record.
Provides the U.S. FDA UDI device identifier (DI) element
Identifies a device related to a donation (e.g., whole blood).
The field contains the universal identifier for the clinical trial
This field contains an alternate identifier that may be used as agreed upon by messaging parties.
This field contains the universal identifier for the clinical trial.
The first component of this field contains the product manufacturer's unique alphanumeric identifier for this specific event.
This field contains the facility identifier
The shipment id is the identifier assigned by the shipment transportation provider that uniquely identifies this shipment from all other shipments by the same provider.
The internal shipment id is an identifier assigned to the shipment by the sender or addressee of the shipment.
The Package ID uniquely identifies this package from all other packages within its shipment
The parent package id identifies the package which contains this package
This field contains a unique identifier for one of the multiple repetitions of this segment, to be used in conjunction with the preceding field
This field contains a unique identifier for one of the multiple repetitions of this segment, to be used in conjunction with the preceding field.
This field contains a unique identifier for one of the multiple repetitions of this segment, to be used in conjunction with the preceding field.
This field contains the study number established by the study sponsor
This field contains the local or collaborators' cross-referenced study numbers.
Uniquely identifies a specific recorded consent. This may be the number assigned to an electronic consent, or may be the number on a printed consent form
This field contains a unique document identification number assigned by the sending system.
This field contains a document number that identifies the parent document to which this document belongs
This field is the placer application's order number
This field is the order number associated with the filling application
This field contains placer application's permanent identifier for the appointment request (and the scheduled appointment itself, when confirmed as booked by the filler application).
This field contains the filler application's permanent identifier for the appointment request (and the scheduled appointment itself, when confirmed as a booked slot by the filler application).
This field relates a child to its parent, when a parent-child relationship exists.
This field relates a child to its parent, when a parent-child relationship exists.
This field is the placer application's order number for the order associated with this scheduling request
This field is the order number assigned by the filler application for the order associated with this scheduling request

This field contains the placer application's permanent identifier for the appointment request (and the scheduled appointment itself, when it has been confirmed as a booked slot by the filler application).

This field contains the filler application's permanent identifier for the appointment request (and the scheduled appointment itself, when it has been confirmed as a booked slot by the filler application).
This field relates a child to its parent, when a parent-child relationship exists. It contains the placer application's permanent identifier for the parent of the appointment request.
This field relates a child to its parent, when a parent-child relationship exists. It contains the filler application's permanent identifier for the parent of the appointment request.
This field is the placer application's order number for the order associated with this scheduling filler application response.
This field is the order number assigned by the filler application for the order associated with this scheduling filler response.
This field contains the originating application's permanent identifier for the referral.

This field contains an external application's permanent identifier for the referral. That is, this referral identifier does not belong to the application that originated the referral and assigned the originating referral identifier.
This field contains the coverage application's permanent identifier assigned to track the authorization and all related billing documents

This field contains the unique identifier assigned by an initiating system to this instance of the goal. It is required that the value in this field be unique over time. This instance ID identifies a specific instance for a specific patient and is unique across all patients.
This field uniquely identifies the episode of care to which this goal applies. Based on application use, this field is required to be unique over time.

td.p: This field contains the identifier assigned by an initiating system to an instance of a problem. It is required that this value remain unique over time. This instance ID identifies a specific instance for a specific patient and is unique across all patients.

td.span: This field uniquely identifies the episode of care to which this problem applies.
Based on application use, this field is required to be unique over time.

td.p: This field contains a value generated by the originating application that represents an associated order placer group number, or other unique identifier assigned to the grouping of pathway directives. It is required that this value remain unique over time. This instance ID identifies a specific instance for a specific patient and is unique across all patients.

tr.td: This field contains the unique identifier of the specific variance record.
This field contains the instance identifier of this relationship
This field contains the Instance ID of the Source Segment
This field contains the Instance ID of the Target Segment
This field contains the Instance ID of the Person or Organization that asserted the relationship
This field identifies the equipment. This is the identifier from an institution's master list of equipment. The <namespace ID> identifies the institution.

td.p: This field identifies the laboratory accession. This identifier is assigned by the external laboratory information system.
This field identifies the laboratory accession. This identifier is assigned by the information system of the laboratory performing the tests.
This field identifies the container. This field is the container's unique identifier assigned by the corresponding equipment

If this field is filled in, it identifies the primary container from which this specimen came. For primary samples this field is empty; for aliquot samples this field should contain the identifier of primary container
This field identifies the container in a particular device

tr.td: This field identifies the carrier. It is the ID (e.g., number or bar code) of the carrier where the container (e.g., tube) is located.
This field identifies the tray identifier (e.g., a number of a tray or a bar code on the tray) where the container carrier is located

This field identifies the test application code assigned by the manufacturer of the equipment or reagents and associated with performing of the particular test specified by the Universal Test Identifier.
This field expresses the identifier of the certificate's subject as used by the certifying body.
This field contains a unique identifier of the specific role record
Unique Invoice Number assigned by the Provider Application
Unique Invoice Number assigned by the Payer Application
Contract/agreement number issued by Payer which must be specified in some circumstances by the Provider
Unique Product/Service Section Number assigned by the Provider Application
Unique Product/Service Section Number assigned by the Payer Application.
Unique Product/Service Group Number assigned by the Provider Application
Unique Product/Service Group Number assigned by the Payer Application
Unique Product/Service Line Item Number assigned by the Provider Application
Unique Product/Service Line Item Number assigned by the Payer Application
Identifier for this Product/Service Line Item assigned by the Provider Application. This will be echoed on all interactions between participants for this Product/Service Line Item
Identifier for this Product/Service Line Item assigned by the Payer Application. This will be echoed on all interactions between participants for this Product/Service Line Item
Health Documents (electronic or paper) that support this Product/Service Line Item
Unique Adjustment Number assigned by the Provider Application
Unique Adjustment Number assigned by the Payer Application
Unique Provider Adjustment Number assigned by the Provider Application that is referenced by this Payer Adjustment
Provider Product/Service Line Item Number Cross Reference

Unique Provider Product/Service Line Item Number assigned by the Provider Application that is referenced by this Payer Adjustment; used for groups with multiple line items that need to be singled out by a Payer Adjustment
Unique Payment/Remittance Advice number for the sending Network Application ID
Unique check number from the Payer's application system.
Unique IPR Number assigned by the Payer Application
Cross reference to Provider Product/Service Group Number or Provider Product/Service Line Item Number from original Invoice

td.p: Cross reference to Payer Product/Service Group Number or Payer Product/Service Line Item Number from original Invoice.

tr.td: The Item Identifier is a unique code assigned to the material item by the Item Inventory Master catalog software application to identify the item
This field identifies the identifying code of the manufacturer of the item
The Item Identifier is a unique code assigned to the material item by the Item Inventory Master catalog software application to identify the item.
The Material Safety Data Sheet Number is the manufacturer's identification number for the Material Saftey Data Sheet (if one exists for the item)
This field contains the identifier of the vendor in the system
This field contains the catalog number assigned to the item by a purchasing vendor
This field contains the code identifying an inventory supply location that stocks or purchases this item
This field contains the code identifying the source location that purchases and stocks items in addition to filling supply requests for the location specified in IVT-2, Inventory Location Identifier
A unique code assigned to a bin location located within the inventory location in IVT-2, where the inventory supply item may be stored
This field contains the general ledger number for the default inventory asset account used in journal transactions associated with items stored in this inventory location
The substitute item is an item that is recommended as a substitute for the corresponding item in ITM-1.
The latex-free substitute item is an item that is latex-free, recommended as a substitute for the corresponding item in the ITM-1 segment when a latex-free item is needed
The unique identifier of the device
A unique number associated with an instance of a sterilization/decontamination cycle assigned by the instrument-tracking system
The Item Identifier is a unique code assigned to the material item by the Instrument-tracking software application to identify the item being sterilized or decontaminated
A unique number associated with an instance of a sterilization/decontamination cycle assigned by the instrument-tracking system

The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. See Section 2.A.33, "HD - hierarchic designator".
See Section 2.A.33.1, "Namespace ID (IS)" for definition. The component intentionally remains associated with the IS data type in v 2.7.
The namespace for the identifier value
Works for OIDs but I’m not sure about other ID types
See Section 2.A.33.3, "Universal ID Type (ID)," for definition.
